org.rcsb.mmtf.codec

Class ArrayConverters

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rcsb.mmtf.codec.ArrayConverters

  • public class ArrayConverters
extends Object
    Class of functions to convert arrays to readable types. e.g. byte arrays to integer arrays.
    Author:
    Anthony Bradley

      • decodeChainList

        public static String[] decodeChainList(byte[] currentChainList,
                                       int length)
        Find all the chain ids from a single byte array. Each byte encodes a different ASCII character.
        Parameters:
        currentChainList - the byte array of the chain list input.
        length - the number of bytes array takes
        Returns:
        the string array of the parsed chain ids

      • combineIntegers

        public static int[] combineIntegers(int[] twoByteIntArray,
                                    int[] fourByteIntArray)
        Combine integer arrays. The first is an array purely of integers to be added. The second contains integers in pairs. The first in the pair is to be added. The second in the pair is the number of integers to read from the first array.
        Parameters:
        twoByteIntArray - an array of integers
        fourByteIntArray - an array of integers in pairs. The first in the pair is to be added to the output array. The second in the pair is the number of integers to read from the first array.
        Returns:
        the integer array output.

      • convertIntegerToChar

        public static char[] convertIntegerToChar(int[] integerArray)
        Convert an integer array to a char array. Cast each integer to a char using the int as the ASCII value.
        Parameters:
        integerArray - the input integer array
        Returns:
        the converted char array

      • convertIntegersToBytes

        Convert an integer array to byte array, where each integer is encoded by a single byte.
        Parameters:
        intArray - the input array of integers
        Returns:
        the byte array of the integers

      • splitIntegers

        public static List<int[]> splitIntegers(int[] inputArray)
        Convert an input array of integers to two arrays. The first output array is a four byte integer array. The integers in this array are in pairs. The first in each pair is part of the
        Parameters:
        inputArray - the array of integers to be split.
        Returns:
        a list of two integer arrays. The first is of four byte integers.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • encodeChainList

        public static byte[] encodeChainList(String[] chainNames,
                                     int length)
        Convert the chain names to a byte array.
        Parameters:
        chainNames - the list of chain names as string
        length - max length of chars in a string
        Returns:
        the byte array of the chain names

      • recursiveIndexEncode

        public static int[] recursiveIndexEncode(int[] in)
        Encodes an input array of integers following a Recursive Indexing strategy (uses a reduced alphabet with fixed limits). To encode a number N that exceed an upper limit of the reduced alphabet (Smax), the encoder keeps reducing this number by subtracting (adding if N is negative) Smax from N, stopping when the number lies in the limits of a reduced alphabet.
        Parameters:
        in - the array of integer values to be encoded
        Returns:
        the encoded array

      • recursiveIndexDecode

        public static int[] recursiveIndexDecode(int[] in)
        Decodes an input array of integers following a Recursive Indexing strategy. To decode the array, the coder keeps adding all the elements of the index, stopping when the index value is between (inclusive of ends) the limits of the reduced alphabet.
        Parameters:
        in - the array of integer values to be decoded
        Returns:
        the decoded array
